q1.question: [T/F] A DFA can proccess inputs from left to right or right to left.

q2.description: DFA has a control unit (with states). The Control Unit defines what to do when in a given state and with a given symbol on the current square of the tape.
q2.question: What state is the given DFA in?

q3.description: DFA can only change state before going to the next letter to the right. That is, an acceptor does not modify the contents of the tape.
q3.question: [T/F] DFAs can be used to add more letters to the given input.

q4.description: The word Deterministic in this context has the particular meaning: When the DFA is in a given state, there is only one thing that it can do for any given input symbol.
q4.question: [T/F] Given a string as an input, DFA can end in different states.

q5.description: A non-deterministic machine might have some range of options on how to proceed when in a given state with a given symbol.
q5.question: [T/F] A DFA machine may be a non-deterministic machine.

q6.description: The word Acceptor in DFA means that: at the end of the processing the letters of the input string, the DFA can answer Yes or No
q6.question: Suppose we have a DFA that tests to see if a string is a valid integer. What will be the result of giving it this input: 23213

q7.description: The word Acceptor in DFA means that: at the end of the processing the letters of the input string, the DFA can answer Yes or No
q7.question: Suppose we have a DFA that tests to see if a string is a valid Java identifier. Which of the following will be REJECTED by this proposed DFA?
